intro: Buteraea parishii, commonly known as the Paraguay buttercup, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy, often toxic species. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers with five petals and a hairy, lobed leaf structure. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Buteraea parishii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
